greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write the prime numbers in a string: 2357111317192329... (cf. A033308). The sequence gives the first position in the string for natural numbers.
comment: Same as A229190 but omitting the a(0) term.
Defined for all a by the normality of the Copeland-Erdős constant. - _Aaron Weiner_, Sep 19 2013
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
example: The first occurrence of "111" in the string is 5, so a(111)=5.
maple: with(StringTools): s:="": for n from 1 to 300 do s:=cat(s,convert(ithprime(n),string)): od: seq(Search(convert(n,string),s),n=1..62); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 26 2011
mathematica: With[{prd=Flatten[IntegerDigits/@Prime[Range[1000]]],nn=10},Flatten[ Table[ SequencePosition[ prd,IntegerDigits[ n],1],{n,70}],1]][[All,1]] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 12 2019 *)
program: s = "".join(str(p) for p in primerange(1, plimit+1))
return [1+s.find(str(n)) for n in takewhile(lambda i: str(i) in s, count(1))]
xref: Cf. A229190 (same sequence but including the a(0) term).
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Sep 20 2009
